Articles.Content: Is there a list of Science Regions for each body available somewhere? Preferably without spoiling Discoverables. I just want to minimise needless hopping around the Mun checking whether or not I've found every Region on it.

From what I can tell, the celestial bodies in KSP2 have much fewer biomes than in KSP1, often around just 4 or 5. Additionally, the  biomes don't seem to give new science when doing anything besides a surface sample (And possibly a crew observation). I can't find any lists of biomes for KSP2, but honestly, it's not really worth it unless you want to absolutely maximize science. Il just say that if it looks a lot different, it's probably a different biome. It's much harder to science spam in KSP2.

The KSP Wiki has a list of KSP2 biomes, but it is massively underdeveloped. Many CBs have many biomes, but the Wiki doesn't mention them.

 

Maybe someone would go exploring everywhere and logging the biomes and adding them to the Wiki!

If you don't mind using a mod, the Science Arkive add-on lists all of the science regions for each body. Optionally (turned off by default) it lists the discoverables as well, though not their locations.
